moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. c3 Nf6 4. Be2 Nc6: I am used to seeing Nxc3 here.
moves.8... Nb4 9. Bb5+: I wanted to deny black a chance to castle.
moves.9... Bd7 10. Bxd7+ Kxd7 11. Nxe4: White makes this Faustian bargain where he grabs the knight but gives up his rook.  He hopes that he can get two knights for the rook.
moves.11... Nc2+ 12. Ke2 Nxa1 13. Nc3: The houdini chess engine thinks that Qd3 is the better move.  He should not fear Qxa2 because of Qb5+ Kc8 (Kc7 Nc5!) (Kd8?, Ne5! dxe5 Nc5!), Be3 Qa6, Rc1+ Kd8, Qxa6 bxa6, Rxa1.
moves.14. Qd3 Bg7 15. Bd2 Nb3: Much better is Nc2, Qxc2 Rfc8, Qb3 Qa6+ with an equal position.
moves.16. axb3 e5: This move loses because it allows the king to become exposed.
moves.17. dxe6 e.p.+ fxe6 18. Nb5 Qa6 19. Ra1: White offers a rook knowing that he can checkmate black if the rook is taken.
moves.19... Qc6 20. Rc1: Black's best option, although still very bad, is to pay Rhc8 or d5 and give up the queen.
moves.20... Qb6 21. Be3: Now if Qa6, Rc7+ is strong.  Then if Ke8 (Kd8, Bg5+), Rxg7 with threats of both Nxd6+ and Nc7+.  If Kg8 then Bh6 is strong.
